body.p: To his Excellency Thomas E. Bramlette. Governor of Kentucky:

Your petitioners would represent that at the present October Term of the Mason Circuit Court, Robert Lynn was indicted by the grand jury for dealing Farro -- and immediately upon the return of the indictment into court, without troubling the Commonwealth to make out proof in the cause appeared in court and plead guilty to the indictment and was fined five Hundred dollars, the penalty affixed by the statute. We have Known Mr Lynn for many years; he is a kindhearted, inoffensive citizen and poor, unable to pay a fine of this magnitude, he being without property or means to do so -- He was induced to deal faro, for some young friends, and hence his present difficulty. The costs of the suit, including the Commonwealth's attorneys portion of the fine, will be a heavy punishment for his offence. We would therefore
respectfully pray your Excellency that said fine may be remitted, as we believe this as a proper case for the interposition of Executive clemency We have no doubt this young man was led into this matter, without being fully aware of its being a violation of law --

R, H, Stanton
Thos I. Throop
L. Halinger
C. G. Cady Mayor
Jno G. Rogers
Late Lt Col 54th Ky Vols
J S White, Late Lt Colonl 16th Ky
Wm R.Wood
Jno M Duke
T. C Campbell
Jno M Duke Jr.

Mason Cir Ct
vs
Robt Lynn
$500,
Faro
Remitted 11 Oct 1865
